channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 4 injured after Delta Air Lines flight aborted during takeoff in Atlanta
item.description: Four people were injured when a Delta Air Lines flight departing from Atlanta on Friday morning was forced to abort during takeoff. The incident comes...

item.title: Two pearls, a saw, a toy - this is what the survivors of LA fires went back for
item.description: Residents of LA's Altadena neighbourhood are picking through the rubble after fires destroyed their homes.

item.title: Fox News headed for trial, again, over 2020 election fraud claims
item.description: The defamation case brought by voting technology company Smartmatic against Fox News can proceed, a New York state appellate court rules.

item.title: LA Mayor Karen Bass faces critical leadership test as questions emerge about wildfire response
Californians scrambled to evacuate dogs, cats, horses, even pigs as LA flames closed in
With their Los Angeles-area homes still smoldering, families return to search the ruins for memories
item.description: Some Los Angeles area residents have begun returning to their still smoldering neighborhoods to search for memories even as the threat of new fires pe...

item.title: A small seafood restaurant turns into a national donation hub for LA fire victims
item.description: In response to the devastating fires raging in LA, a small restaurant in Surf City USA has become a channel for big help — from locals to people acros...

item.title: When Carter met Kim - and stopped a nuclear war
item.description: The former US president halted a US-North Korea showdown, but was also accused of going rogue.

item.title: Blue Origin to launch New Glenn rocket after 10 years of development
item.description: Space company Blue Orbit will be launching its New Glenn rocket on Sunday after more than 10 years of development. CBS News space consultant William H...

item.title: Video captures family's harrowing escape as Palisades Fire engulfs home
item.description: Social media video of one family's dramatic escape Tuesday from the inferno that engulfed their Pacific Palisades home prompted an outpouring of suppo...

item.title: What to know about the Supreme Court TikTok hearing
item.description: The Supreme Court heard arguments over the fate of TikTok on Friday. The popular social media app could be federally banned in the U.S. later this mon...

item.title: 'My father should die in prison' - daughter of Dominique Pelicot in exclusive interview
item.description: Caroline Darian has become a vocal advocate for victims of sexual violence in the wake of her mother's trial.

item.title: Venezuela's Maduro begins new term as US raises arrest bounty
item.description: The US announces an increased $25 million reward for information leading to the arrest of Venezuelas President Maduro on day he's sworn in for a third...

item.title: More than half a million students were out of school because of LA fires this week
item.description: School districts in and around Los Angeles shut down because of the fires. That includes LAUSD, the second largest school district in the country.

item.title: New photos show the volcanic plains of Mercury after a spacecraft fly-by
item.description: The BepiColombo spacecraft flew less than 200 miles from Mercury's surface and photographed volcanic plains and icy craters.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan hug residents in Pasadena
item.description: The couple live near Santa Barbara in the town of Montecito.

item.title: González calls on Venezuelan military to reject Maduro
item.description: In a video posted on social media, Edmundo González accused Nicolás Maduro of carrying out "a coup d'état" by consolidating power.

item.title: US and UK toughen sanctions on Russian oil industry
item.description: The actions are aimed at cutting off revenue Moscow is using to fund its war in Ukraine.
